title: Emulating the Masters of Photography
summary: In this Learn+ episode, the hosts explore the styles of four legendary photographers—Yousef Karsh, Richard Avedon, Irving Penn, and Lillian Bassman. They analyze lighting, styling, and expressions to recreate iconic looks across six different shoots, demonstrating how to draw inspiration from the masters for modern photography.

steps.action: Introduction to the concept of emulating master photographers.
Identification of the four masters to be studied: Yousef Karsh, Richard Avedon, Irving Penn, and Lillian Bassman.
Analysis of the masters' work to understand their creative process.
Breakdown of specific elements to emulate: expressions, lighting, styling, and overall sensibilities.
Demonstration of lighting setups using strobes, softboxes, and reflectors to achieve specific looks.
Execution of six different photo shoots applying these techniques.

key_takeaways: Study the work of masters like Karsh, Avedon, Penn, and Bassman to improve photography skills.
Deconstruct images by analyzing lighting, styling, and subject expression.
Apply historical techniques to create modern work with a classic influence.
